alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Coastal Areas; San Diego County Inland Valleys (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 20 at 1:48AM PST until December 21 at 9:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following areas, Coachella Valley, Riverside County Mountains, San Diego County Coastal Areas, San Diego County Deserts, San Diego County Mountains, San Diego County Valleys and San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A Pacific storm system will bring showers and chance of thunderstorms. The heavier and more widespread rainfall is expected for late Thursday into Friday when rainfall rates could reach one inch per hour. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: San Diego County Coastal Areas; San Diego County Inland Valleys
